@JonTreichel All the best.
@JonTreichel When you've got a CBC guy defending the Fraser Institute? ;)
@JonTreichel But, yes, context is good. Personally, I prefer to go to academic economists on economic issues.
@JonTreichel *they're
@JonTreichel Oh I don't think so. These days, after the great realignment, there's on the left side of the liberal/populist divide.
@JonTreichel I understand. I think media could do a better job in describing what Fraser Institute is.
@JonTreichel That may be. I really don't think they're mainstream though - I think they're hated on all sides.
@JonTreichel Fraser Institute is relatively clear on what they are. Private sector economists (mostly) with a specific ideology.
@JonTreichel I think there's a big difference between Fraser Institute and the kind of groups we're talking about.
@JonTreichel Yeah. We did cede the idea of free speech over traditional airwaves to gov, for better or worse. Over the internet, bigger Q.
@JonTreichel But, we came up with these ideas before some asshole could lie on the internet to millions so I don't know
@JonTreichel ...the harms of limiting speech are many. Allowing people to denounce repugnant speech, better.
@JonTreichel Those are big questions with difficult answers, and who the hell knows. But the liberal (broad sense) answer is...
